[b] Portal is the best tutorial game ever made. [/b]
Story? Its fun, but simple.
[b] Puzzles? [/b]Groundbreaking. There are zero puzzles that aren't incredibly well thought out, and not an ounce of my time was spent wondering why a level was poorly made. The levels are perfect.
[b]Gameplay?[/b] Brother, you're playing with the Portal gun, so the gameplay is perfect.
[b]Tutorial?[/b] I mentioned that this game was a tutorial. It is. On its own, this game is quite short, and doesn't offer much in terms of story or truly complicated puzzles. However, if viewed as a tutorial for the best puzzle game ever made, Portal 2, it is a wonderful experience. It and its sequel are fantastic, and I replay them every year, wishing that I could experience them again for the first time.
[b]Oh, and the cake?[/b] [spoiler]A lie.[/spoiler]

Well, going through the story line was fun and exciting , and the graphics are LITERALLY  the best I've ever seen. seriously awesome. However, it didn't take to much time as long as your reasonably good at using your head and solving puzzles, and once you complete the story line, there isn't much else to do. All in all, GREAT game, just not a ton of game play.

Portal and its sequel should go down as two of the best games of all time. This first game is less polished than Portal 2, but it is the game that blew minds when it first came out. The game is very short, can be completed in one sitting if you figure out the puzzles. I highly recommend this game to any gamer period.
Portal is an absolute masterpiece. If you have not played it yet I highly encourage you to play it at lest once

Great game. May still be a little old... but it is still fun compared to repetitive campaigns like Call of Duty. It is a classic and is still a puzzle to new players. To anyone that wants to buy this game, buy this, and buy the second. It has been fun playing this and the second. If you have played CoD or Halo and liked the campaigns, you should play this. It may be different than other games, but it is still good. Overall this franchise is fun.

[h1]Dwarfed by Portal 2[/h1]

After playing Portal 2 first, this game is lacking in every way. Older tech aside, this ancestor is missing all of the things that make Portal 2 pure gold.
[list]
[*]Far too many puzzles require just the right amount of momentum or kill you if you miss a jump by a few pixels.
[*]There's only one character and it's not very well developed.
[*]It's very short; about 20 puzzles plus some "in between navigation".
[/list]
At the time, I can see how this game made history, but now it's not worth the time unless you are a game history aficionado.
This was a triumph.

Not everyday are you able to go play a gaming classic almost blind. Yesterday was such a day. In 3 hours, I've beaten the main game, and look forward to extra levels and Portal 2. 

It's very hard to unlearn things, and first-person puzzlers with a gimmick have been a staple of the indie scene for years now. When this game was released, I was on gaming hiatus. However, when I was made aware that this game existed, its main immediately appealed to me. Despite being blueprinted to death, I can remember how novel Portal's concept felt. Now, this would've been a great game regardless, but knowing how innovative it was makes it all the more notable.

It's very much still worth playing in 2021. Sure, Source looks dated, explosions/breakables are low-poly, UI is barebones and subtitles are, well, I suppose them existing is the only positive I can mention, but it's still good looking enough for graphics not to be a distraction. The dark humour is tremendous, and the end credits are literally the best ones I've ever seen. 

If you have this in your collection and haven't played it yet, do it. It's not as fresh and lively as it would've been 14 years ago, but it's definitely worth a gander.

It's just a total classic. So fun to play and a testament to the fact that you don't need an incredible amount of action or killing to make a game exciting. And that is coming from a CounterStrike player. I can even play it with my little sister.
